isis.stitle: CAB: 5000i AND 9000i CONVENTIONAL - REMOVE - Remove COWL TRAY

svcproc.title: Remove COWL TRAY

step1.para:
Remove windshield wiper arm and blade assemblies. Refer to
WINDSHIELD WIPER ARM AND BLADE ASSEMBLY
, Remove Windshield Wiper Arm and Blade Assembly.

svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 82 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: On standard 5000 i series and 9000 i series, remove cowl tray (Item 4) as follows:

step2.para: Remove windshield washer hoses (Items 1 and 2) from three retaining clips (Item 3) on cowl tray (Item 4).

Remove windshield washer hose (Item 2) coming from windshield washer bottle from tee fitting (Item 5) of windshield washer hose assembly. Leave windshield washer hoses (Items 1 and 2) lay in the cowl tray (Item 4).
Remove four hex flanged bolts (Item 6) securing cowl tray (Item 4) to engine side of dash panel.
Remove four hex flanged bolts (Item 7) securing air intake screen (Item 8) and cowl tray (Item 4) to air duct inlet (Item 9). The air intake screen may be stuck on the cowl tray; if so, leave it.
To remove cowl tray from vehicle refer to Step 5 below.

step1.para: On 5000 i series and 9000 i series with external air cleaners, remove cowl tray (Item 10) as follows:

step2.para: Remove windshield washer hoses (Items 1 and 2) from three retaining clips (Item 3) on cowl tray (Item 10).

Remove windshield washer hose (Item 2) coming from windshield washer bottle from tee fitting (Item 5) of windshield washer hose assembly. Leave windshield washer hoses (Items 1 and 2) lay in the cowl tray (Item 10).
Remove four hex flanged bolts (Item 6) securing cowl tray (Item 4) to engine side of dash panel.
To remove cowl tray from vehicle refer to Step 5 below.

step1.para: On 5000 i series with a butterfly hood, remove cowl tray (Item 11) as follows:

step2.para: Remove butterfly hood before removing the cowl tray. Refer to GROUP 09 - HOOD, GRILLE, AND FENDERS in the Master Service Manual.
Remove windshield washer hoses (Items 1 and 2) from three retaining clips (Item 3) on cowl tray (Item 11).

Remove windshield washer hose (Item 2) coming from windshield washer bottle from tee fitting (Item 5) of windshield washer hose assembly. Leave windshield washer hoses (Items 1 and 2) lay in the cowl tray (Item 11).
Remove four hex flanged bolts (Item 6) securing cowl tray (Item 11) to engine side of dash panel.
Remove four hex flanged bolts (Item 7) securing air intake screen (Item 8) and cowl tray (Item 11) to air duct inlet (Item 9). The air intake screen may be stuck on the cowl tray; if so, leave it.

Remove three hex lock nuts and flat washers (Item 12) securing rear hood hinge retainer bracket (Item 13) to cowl tray (Item 11). Remove rear hood hinge retainer bracket from the three threaded studs (Item 14) and lay it out of the way.
To remove cowl tray from vehicle refer to Step 5 below.

calloutgroup.callout1: 10. COWL TRAY (MODELS WITH EXTERNAL AIR CLEANERS)
12. HEX LOCK NUT, 5/16-18 UNC AND FLAT WASHER, 5/16

svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 83 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: With all mounting hardware removed, pull cowl tray (Item 1) away from engine side of dash panel on passenger side. Push grommet (Item 2) through hole in cowl tray and pull windshield washer hose (Item 3) with grommet from windshield washer bottle out of hole in cowl tray. Lay washer hose and grommet out of the way.

figure.caption: Figure 83. Washer Hose and Cowl Tray

svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 84 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Before removing cowl tray (Item 1) from cowl, note if the cowl tray drain tube (Item 2) is positioned behind air cleaner (Item 3). If it is, note how it is routed, this will help when reinstalling cowl tray if cowl tray drain tube is pulled out with cowl tray. You may remove cowl tray drain tube from cowl tray by squeezing drain tube clamp (Item 4). Separate cowl tray drain tube from cowl tray, leaving cowl tray drain tube in place. Remove cowl tray and lay it out of the way.

figure.caption: Figure 84. Cowl Tray Drain Tube and Cowl Tray
